p: The results from temporal cluster analysis indicated that the DF clusters occurred mainly in autumn, particularly, in late August to early November. Indigenous DF cases peaked seasonally despite limited intra-annual climatic variability and seasonal fluctuations. In addition, the availability of immature densities of Aedes albopictus (primary vector in Guangzhou) was consistent with the dengue seasonality [ 37, 38] as the vector biology and viral replication are temperature and moisture dependent [ 39, 40]. These results could be used in planning future prevention and control measures towards DF, particularly, during the high-risk season.
